abstract: Bronx District Attorney Robert T Johnson's decision to seek judgeship stands to benefit his wife, Justice Dianne T Renwick, as well as Democratic party; Johnson's position as prosecutor currently poses problem for Renwick in her quest to become presiding justice in appellate court, as she would have to recuse herself in all cases involving criminal cases in Bronx; Johnson's move to the bench would eliminate that potential complication.
lead_paragraph: If Mr. Johnson becomes a judge, it would bolster Justice Dianne T. Renwick’s chances of being selected by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to head the state appellate court.

headline.main: Judgeship Bid by Robert Johnson, Bronx District Attorney, Could Bolster Wife’s Career
headline.print_headline: Judgeship Bid by Prosecutor Could Bolster Wife’s Career

snippet: If Mr. Johnson becomes a judge, it would bolster Justice Dianne T. Renwick’s chances of being selected by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo to head the state appellate court.
